conclusion: Analyze what happens when objects A and B are moved through the air and placed at the locations of objects C, D, E, and F.
Object A appears to be a pink/salmon-colored rectangular block or container.
Object B appears to be a patterned zigzag/chevron textured material.
Object C appears to be a yellow vertical block.
Object D appears to be a purple vertical block.
Object E appears to be a brown block.
Object F appears to be a blue vertical block.
Objects A and B move through the air and are placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, F, coming into contact due to gravity.
Consider what happens in a physical interaction where Object A and B are placed where objects C, D, E, or F currently are.
Contact 'due to gravity' indicates standard gravitational effects - objects will rest on top of each other or potentially displace each other.
If object A is placed at the locations of C, D, E, or F, it would likely displace these smaller objects due to its larger size or rest on top of them if carefully balanced.

If object B is placed at the locations of C, D, E, or F, it would likely drape over or around these objects if it's flexible, potentially causing the vertical blocks to fall over if placed with force.
Object B would rest partially on top of the blocks, taking on their shape underneath due to gravity.

Final answer: Objects A and B will come into contact with objects C, D, E, and F due to gravity, with object A displacing or resting on smaller blocks and object B conforming to the shapes of objects C, D, E, and F.
